Seventh Section
The Discussion of What is Given Here
“They maintain themselves there on what is given here?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Ito cīvaraṁ denti taṁ cīvaraṁ tattha paribhuñjantīti?
analyzed: itas cīvaram denti tam cīvaram tattha paribhuñjanti iti
translated: “They use the robe-cloth given here?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽ito piṇḍapātaṁ denti, ito senāsanaṁ denti, ito gilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṁ denti, ito khādanīyaṁ denti, ito bhojanīyaṁ denti, ito pānīyaṁ denti;

“They use the almsfood given here, the resting place given here, the requisite of medicine as cure for the sick given here, the fresh foods given here, the cooked foods given here, the drinks given here?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the abandoning of lust, the abandoning of hatred, the abandoning of delusion?
“They maintain themselves there on what is given here?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Añño aññassa kārako parakataṁ sukhadukkhaṁ añño karoti, añño paṭisaṁvedetīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….

translated: “One person acts for another, and what is done by one ripens on another. One person acts and another experiences?”🔽“No.”
“It should not be said that
‘they maintain themselves there on what is given here.’“
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Nanu petā attano atthāya dānaṁ dentaṁ anumodenti, cittaṁ pasādenti, pītiṁ uppādenti, somanassaṁ paṭilabhantīti?
analyzed: nanu petāḥ attanaḥ atthāya dānam dentam anumodenti cittam pasādenti pītim uppādenti somanassam paṭilabhanti iti
translated: “Don’t they rejoice in one who gives a gift for their sake, gladden their hearts, arouse rapture, and attain bliss?”
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Hañci petā attano atthāya dānaṁ dentaṁ anumodenti, cittaṁ pasādenti, pītiṁ uppādenti, somanassaṁ paṭilabhanti;
analyzed: hañci petāḥ attanaḥ atthāya dānam dentam anumodenti cittam pasādenti pītim uppādenti somanassam paṭilabhanti
translated: Do the deceased rejoice in the gift given for their sake, do they gladden their hearts, do they arouse joy, do they attain happiness?
“Then it must be said that
‘what is given here benefits those there.’
“It shouldn’t be said that
‘what is given here benefits those there.’
“Ānanda,
wasn’t it said by me:
‘When rain falls on a mountaintop🔽and flows down through the valleys,
it fills the streams,
which in turn fill the lakes.
And the lakes fill the rivers,
and the rivers fill the ocean.
In the same way, what is given here
benefits those there.
There’s no farming there,
no cattle raising.
There’s no trade,
no buying or selling.
The deceased there
live off what is given here.’
“Is there such a discourse?”

translated: ‘He will be our heir,’ ‘he will do the work,’ ‘he will look after our property,’ ‘he will make offerings to the gods on our behalf,’ ‘he will make offerings to departed relatives on our behalf.’🔽These are the five reasons why parents want a child to be born into the family.”

analyzed: puttam icchanti paṇḍitā  tasmā santaḥ sappurisā

Therefore good people, who know what has been done for them,
